class_notes:
Course will meet once per week on Tuesdays.
(Same as WGS 475RW 2)
Feminist Philosophies: On Race within Latinx Feminisms 
Course Description: 
This course will explore race in Latinx feminisms, focusing on blackness and anti-blackness within the Latinx, Latin American, and Caribbean context. Readings will provide occasion to explore the construction as well as critique of the very category of Latinx and Latin-American; critiques and reappropriations of the language of mestizaje; the notion of amefricanidade and afro-latinamerican feminisms; and the challenges and possibilities of coalitional politics. The course will also discuss Latinx, Latin-American, and Caribbean feminisms' debt to black feminism.  
 
Texts by: Sojourner Truth, Combahee River Collective, Audre Lorde, Frances Beale, Gloria Anzaldúa, María Lugones, Chela Sandoval, Lélia González, Betty Ruth Lozano, Yuderkys Espinosa Miñoso, Ochy Curiel, Yulexis Almedia Juncos, Yomaira Figueroa, and La Colectiva Feminista en Construcción
course_description: This course explores the central issues in feminist philosophies.
prerequisites: Two PHIL courses or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
